title: Senior Software Engineer
tagsAndSkills: SAP,Front end,LMS,Agile,HTML,Application development,Information management,Monitoring
jobDescription:
• you'll be at the forefront of shaping HR technology solutions for the future. Our HR Tech portfolio includes third-party systems, such as SAP SuccessFactors, Qualtrics and Saba Cloud learning management system.
  • In addition, we have a variety of internally developed products, such as a one-stop-shop HR portal, a chatbot powe'red by AWS Lex, an Employee API, and a micro-learning platform.
  • Our commitment to innovation and cutting-edge cloud computing means you'll work with the latest DevOps tools.
  • you'll collaborate with a dynamic and diverse team of experts and have the chance to grow your skills exponentially. We are a growth-mindset team and approach problems not based on what we already know, but also appreciate using new technologies where needed.
As a Senior Software Engineer , you will
  • Participate in and contribute to requirement assessment and refinement.
  • Design, implement, and maintain AWS-based solutions for HR tech applications.
  • Analyse, plan, and implement system best practices and improvements to optimize AWS infrastructure for cost-effectiveness and better performance.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to cloud services (AWS, Azure).
  • Collaborate and share knowledge with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration with HR systems.
As a successful candidate, you should have
  • Minimum 3 years of IT experience, including proven experience with cloud services and API frameworks.
  • Completed BE/B.Tech/MCA/Post Graduations in Computer Science or other relevant.
  • Experience working with databases (eg PostgreSQL, DynamoDB).
  • Proficiency in scripting languages (eg Python and Node.js).
  • Proficiency in back-end application development (eg Go/Docker).
  • Some experience in front-end application development (eg TypeScript/React/HTML/css).
  • Familiarity with DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines.
  • Understanding of agile ways of working and Atlassian tools, such as Bamboo, Jira, Bitbucket, and Confluence.
  • Experience with Git, monitoring solutions, technical documentation and unit testing.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail and a proactive approach to challenges.
  • Effective communication and teamwork abilities.
  • Interest in new AWS and DevOps tools and GenAI topics.

title: Supervisor - O & M
tagsAndSkills: Plant management,Data analysis,Usage,SAP,Operational excellence,Renewable energy,Mechanical,MS Office
jobDescription:
As a Supervisor O&M (Mechanical) you will be responsible for:
  • Ensuring max availability of Engine and auxiliary equipments.
  • Attending schedule and unscheduled mechanical maintenance activities apart from planning / projection of necessary spares requirement.
  • Carrying out trouble shooting of mechanical equipments installed in the power plant independently and also along with field service engineers as well as customer.
  • Ensuring timely availability of manpower/equipment and resolution of issues in order to achieve trouble free engine running.
  • Co-ordinating with clients for resources.
  • Monitoring staff in order to avoid accidents and damage to property and life.
  • Coordinate operation activities during the shift to ensure that the DG plant is operated according to the demand.
  • Plan and Coordinate operation & Maintenance activities at the plant and/or assigned team during the shift.
  • Ensure that the performance targets of the plant are reached according to the contract in own responsibility area.
  • Train maintenance procedures and standards for the new workers.
  • Ensure that the work is executed at plant according to W rtsil Quality, Health, Safety and Environmental guidelines and customer site procedures.
  • Prioritize and assign tasks so that assigned team resources are used effectively and targets are met.
  • Communicate with the grid control centre and plant management about the loading of the plant.
  • Maintain all operation & maintenance records according to the Plant Management procedures & guidelines assist the superior as required.
  • Develop the operation working routines at the plant.
  • Follow all maintenance procedures according to Wartsila standards.
Requirements:
  • Job Location : Century Enka Limited, Pune.
  • Educational Requirement : Diploma or BE Mechanical.
  • Experience : Minimum 5 years of experience in power plants/marine/industrial environment at supervisory level
  • Expert knowledge of power plant Mechanical systems and equipment
  • Understanding of predictive and preventive maintenance best practices
  • Strong leadership, communication, and organizational abilities
  • Proficiency with MS Office and maintenance data analysis
  • Commitment to safety and operational excellence
